alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:23AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CLAIBORNE...NORTHWESTERN HAWKINS...HANCOCK... GRAINGER...NORTHEASTERN UNION...NORTHWESTERN HAMBLEN AND SOUTH CENTRAL LEE COUNTIES... At 223 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Sneedville to 7 miles west of Rutledge, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Rogersville, Sneedville, Rutledge, New Tazewell, Bean Station, Tazewell, Springdale, Lone Mountain, Howard Quarter and Thorn Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
